params._newSet: List of addresses of the desired active validator set

getValidators().return: The list of addresses of currently active validators

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

reportBenign(address,uint256).details: emits `ReportedBenign` event in the Relayed logic contract

reportMalicious(address,uint256,bytes).details: emits `ReportedMalicious` event in the Relayed logic contract

params._proof: Proof to submit. Right now it is not used for anything

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

callbackInitiateChange(bytes32,address[].notice: This function is used by the Relayed logic contract to iniate a change in the active validator set

finalizeChange().notice: Finalizes changes of the active validator set. Called by SYSTEM

reportBenign(address,uint256).notice: This function is used by validators to submit Benign reports on other validators. Can only be called by the validator who submits the report

reportMalicious(address,uint256,bytes).notice: This function is used by validators to submit Malicious reports on other validators. Can only be called by the validator who submits the report

setRelayed(address).notice: Sets the Relayed logic contract address. Only callable by the owner. The address is assumed to belong to a contract that implements the `IValidatorSetRelayed` interface

userdoc.notice: This owned contract is present in the chainspec file. The Relay contract relays the function calls to a logic contract called Relayed for upgradeability
